content: Biography The Arab-German Young Academy of Sciences and Humanities (AGYA) is based at the Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities (BBAW) and at the Academy of Scientific Research and Technology (ASRT) in Egypt. It was established in 2013 as the first bilateral young academy worldwide. AGYA promotes research cooperation among outstanding early-career researchers (3–10 years post-PhD) from all disciplines who are affiliated with a research institution in Germany or in any Arab country. The academy effectively supports the interdisciplinary projects and collaborative initiatives of its members in various fields of scientific research, science policy and education. AGYA is funded by the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF) and various Arab and German cooperation partners.
summary: Biography The Arab-German Young Academy of Sciences and Humanities (AGYA) is based at the Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences and Humanities (BBAW) and at the Academy of Scientific Research and Technology (ASRT) in Egypt.
title: AGYA Office

content: Biography Alaa Amr is a computer engineer who graduated from the German University in Cairo with high honors. I started working as a Teaching Assistant and began my master’s thesis on the use of AI in healthcare, with a focus on multi-modal deep learning models, attention mechanisms and explainability. I pursued my master’s thesis research in Germany. I also worked as a Research Assistant in the FAIrPaCT project (Federated Artificial Intelligence Framework for Optimizing Pancreatic Cancer) funded by the BMBF.
summary: Biography Alaa Amr is a computer engineer who graduated from the German University in Cairo with high honors. I started working as a Teaching Assistant and began my master’s thesis on the use of AI in healthcare, with a focus on multi-modal deep learning models, attention mechanisms and explainability.
title: Alaa Amr

content:
Biography Assoc. Prof. Amir Roushdy has been an Associate Professor of Mechatronics Engineering at the German University in Cairo (GUC) since 2022. His research focuses on advanced robotics and mechatronic systems, integrating micro-optical sensors, digital twins, and whispering gallery mode (WGM) phenomena for high-precision sensing and control applications. He received his B.Sc. in Mechatronics, followed by an M.Sc. in Mechatronics from the German University in Cairo (GUC), and later earned a Ph.D. from Southern Methodist University (SMU), Dallas, Texas, USA, specializing in micro-optical sensor technologies and their applications in advanced robotics and mechatronic systems. Since 2015, he has been a faculty member in the Mechatronics Engineering Department at GUC. His research is centered on integrating micro-resonator-based opto-mechanical sensors, digital twin technology, and AI-driven automation into robotic and mechatronic systems to enhance perception, control, and interaction. His work has contributed to the development of high-precision optical sensing solutions for humanoid robots, telepresence robots, and AI-assisted robotic platforms.
Prof. Roushdy is the Founder and Head of the ARAtronics Research Center at the GUC, a leading hub for robotics, AI, digital twins, and mechatronics research. His team specializes in designing and developing next-generation robotic systems, including humanoid robots, telepresence robots, and AI-driven automation solutions. Under his leadership, the ARAtronics team has contributed to multiple industry collaborations and international conferences, pushing the boundaries of robotics, digital twins, and optical sensor integration. In addition to his academic leadership, Prof. Roushdy leads ARAtech Innovations, an industry-focused group dedicated to transforming research and development into market-ready products. Through this initiative, he drives the implementation of cutting-edge technologies in robotics, AI, digital twins, and optical sensing for real-world applications.
He has authored numerous peer-reviewed journal articles and conference papers in the fields of robotics, mechatronics, optical sensor technologies, and digital twins. His research contributions have been recognized with multiple awards, including the Best Research Award across the Research Day at SMU, Texas, in 2013. In 2017, he was recognized as a Notable Alumni of SMU, Dallas, Texas, USA, for his contributions to robotics and optical sensing technologies. Prof. Roushdy is a member of the Society of Photo-optical Instrumentation Engineers (SPIE), the American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME), and the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA). He has served as a reviewer for several high-impact journals and as a technical committee member for international conferences in robotics, mechatronics, digital twins, and optical sensing technologies.
summary: Biography Assoc. Prof. Amir Roushdy has been an Associate Professor of Mechatronics Engineering at the German University in Cairo (GUC) since 2022. His research focuses on advanced robotics and mechatronic systems, integrating micro-optical sensors, digital twins, and whispering gallery mode (WGM) phenomena for high-precision sensing and control applications.
title: Amir Roushdy

content: Biography Anna Lisitsyna works with Dr. Shadi Albarqouni at Helmholtz AI as a research scientist. Lisitsyna has acquired a programming and mathematical background at Lomonosov Moscow State Universtity, before relocating to Munich to get a Master’s and learn to apply programming and mathematics to medicine. During the Masters program, she learns Machine Learning, specifically in application to medical imaging data. Her PhD project was conncerned with the application of machine learning to chemical datasets, metabolomics in particular, and developing algorithms and pipelines for data analysis, including neural networks and genetic algorithms.
summary: Biography Anna Lisitsyna works with Dr. Shadi Albarqouni at Helmholtz AI as a research scientist. Lisitsyna has acquired a programming and mathematical background at Lomonosov Moscow State Universtity, before relocating to Munich to get a Master’s and learn to apply programming and mathematics to medicine.
title: Anna Lisitsyna

content: Biography
summary: Biography
title: Aya ElNahas

content: Biography David is currently pursuing his PhD at the University Hospital Bonn, under the guidance of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. With a background in engineering and informatics, he completed his interuniversity master’s degree in AI in 2022 from the Facultat d’Informàtica de Barcelona (FIB), which is a joint program of Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya, Universitat de Barcelona, and Universitat Rovira i Virgili. With over two years of industry experience in software development, David secured the first position in the live SIIM-ISIC 2019 competition for skin lesion classification and published a full paper at the International Conference VISAPP 2023. His goal is to leverage his skills and knowledge to make valuable contributions to the field of AI in medicine at the Albarqouni Lab.
summary: Biography David is currently pursuing his PhD at the University Hospital Bonn, under the guidance of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. With a background in engineering and informatics, he completed his interuniversity master’s degree in AI in 2022 from the Facultat d’Informàtica de Barcelona (FIB), which is a joint program of Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya, Universitat de Barcelona, and Universitat Rovira i Virgili.
title: David D. Gaviria

content: Biography Dr. Dawud Ansari is a distinguished expert in energy and climate, geopolitics, development, and foresight. As a policy advisor at the German Institute for International and Security Affairs (SWP Berlin) and a senior fellow at The Majan Council for Foresight, Strategic Affairs and Energy, he shapes pivotal policy decisions across the EU and GCC regions. With a PhD in applied economics, he is a member of the Mediterranean Energy Experts Circle and a fellow of the Arab-German Young Academy of Humanities and Sciences, collaborating furthermore with leading energy bodies such as the IEA, IRENA, and WEC. Dr. Ansari is also an adjunct professor at the Berlin Institute of Technology and the director of the Energy Access and Development Program. His influential academic publications and policy advisory work focus on technology foresight and decision support in energy, climate, and beyond.
summary: Biography Dr. Dawud Ansari is a distinguished expert in energy and climate, geopolitics, development, and foresight. As a policy advisor at the German Institute for International and Security Affairs (SWP Berlin) and a senior fellow at The Majan Council for Foresight, Strategic Affairs and Energy, he shapes pivotal policy decisions across the EU and GCC regions.
title: Dawud Ansari

content: Biography Diletta is currently pursuing her PhD at the M.O.D.A.L. research group @University of Naples Federico II, under the supervision of Prof. Francesco Piccialli, the lab’s head and scientific director. She holds a master’s degree in Statistical Sciences, completed in 2021 from the same university. With over two years of research experience, particularly in Federated Learning, and collaborations with industries on AI models for Industry and Education 4.0, Diletta aims to leverage her expertise to address open issues in Federated Learning, such as solving statistical and device heterogeneity, making significant contributions to this field of AI.
summary: Biography Diletta is currently pursuing her PhD at the M.O.D.A.L. research group @University of Naples Federico II, under the supervision of Prof. Francesco Piccialli, the lab’s head and scientific director. She holds a master’s degree in Statistical Sciences, completed in 2021 from the same university.
title: Diletta Chiaro

content:
Biography Elodie is in the last year of her PhD at the University of Rennes, under the supervision of Dr. Camille Maumet from the Empenn research team and Prof. Elisa Fromont from the LACODAM research team. After four years of medicine school at the University of Versailles, she took a shift in her career and started a Master’s degree in bioinformatics at the University of Rennes.
Her research focuses on exploring and modelling analytical variability in functional MRI data analyses, particularly using deep representation learning. Her goal is to facilitate the re-use of data shared on public databases by taking into account the different sources of variability. In the future, she would like to focus more in the use of real-world data and on the robustness of machine learning models to privacy attacks.
summary: Biography Elodie is in the last year of her PhD at the University of Rennes, under the supervision of Dr. Camille Maumet from the Empenn research team and Prof. Elisa Fromont from the LACODAM research team.
title: Elodie Germani

content: Biography Elyes is a Mechatronics and Information Technology student at KIT Karlsruhe, currently pursuing his bachelor’s thesis at the University of Bonn under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. His research focuses on AI for detecting inherited retinal diseases in fundus images. Previously, he gained practical experience as a research assistant in data science at the University Hospital Heidelberg, evaluating clinical and anatomical data.
summary: Biography Elyes is a Mechatronics and Information Technology student at KIT Karlsruhe, currently pursuing his bachelor’s thesis at the University of Bonn under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. His research focuses on AI for detecting inherited retinal diseases in fundus images.
title: Elyes Farjallah

content: Biography Hanan Aldarmaki is an assistant professor of natural language processing at Mohammad bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI). Her research covers topics in Arabic NLP and speech processing, including Automatic Speech Processing (ASR), text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis, and semantic representations. She also looks into speech and language disorders, and sign language processing, and applications of AI for accessibility more generally. Aldarmaki earned a Ph.D. in computer science from George Washington University in the United States in 2019, a Master of Philosophy in computer speech, text and internet technology from the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom in 2009, and a B.S. in computer engineering from the American University of Sharjah in 2008.
summary: Biography Hanan Aldarmaki is an assistant professor of natural language processing at Mohammad bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence (MBZUAI). Her research covers topics in Arabic NLP and speech processing, including Automatic Speech Processing (ASR), text-to-speech (TTS) synthesis, and semantic representations.
title: Hanan Aldarmaki

content: Biography Laura’s academic journey began with a Bachelor’s degree in Medical Engineering, followed by a Master’s degree in Applied Physics, which she completed in November 2023 at the University of Applied Sciences of Koblenz and the University of Koblenz. For her Master’s thesis, Laura’s path led her to the University Hospital Bonn. She is currently working there as a scientific researcher in an AI-focused radiology research group. She is also pursuing a PhD with a focus on “Artificial Intelligence in Dose Management”, while undergoing practical training to become a Medical Physics Expert. Throughout her studies, Laura gained experience as a research assistant in various roles, including mentoring girls and young women in STEM fields through the Ada-Lovelace-Project.
summary: Biography Laura’s academic journey began with a Bachelor’s degree in Medical Engineering, followed by a Master’s degree in Applied Physics, which she completed in November 2023 at the University of Applied Sciences of Koblenz and the University of Koblenz.
title: Laura Garajova

content: Biography Mariam Wael is a computer engineer and currently a teaching assistant and researcher at the GUC, Pursuing a master’s degree in deep learning applications in bioinformatics.
summary: Biography Mariam Wael is a computer engineer and currently a teaching assistant and researcher at the GUC, Pursuing a master’s degree in deep learning applications in bioinformatics.
title: Mariam Wael

content: Biography Merlin Engelke is a Data Scientist at the Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, specializing in the development and deployment of machine learning algorithms in healthcare. He holds a Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering from the University of Duisburg-Essen, with a concentration in Mechatronics, and Business Informatics. Previously, Merlin worked as a Data Scientist at Campana & Schott GmbH, focusing on machine learning for business applications and leading cloud service projects. He is currently under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Felix Nensa. Merlin is skilled in C#, .NET Core, SQL Server, Python, Azure DevOps, and Docker, and holds several Azure certifications.
summary: Biography Merlin Engelke is a Data Scientist at the Institute for Artificial Intelligence in Medicine, specializing in the development and deployment of machine learning algorithms in healthcare. He holds a Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering from the University of Duisburg-Essen, with a concentration in Mechatronics, and Business Informatics.
title: Merlin Engelke

content: Biography Dr.-Ing. Mohamad Bdiwi holds a Ph.D. in Robotics from the Technical University of Chemnitz, with over 16 years of extensive experience in the field, including a commendable 7-year tenure in team leadership. He possesses four international patents and has published over 60 scientific papers. Dr. Bdiwi’s primary focus lies in robot control and vision, as well as human-robot collaboration. He has spearheaded numerous research and industrial projects on both national and international fronts, successfully managing the CTC-Collaborative Technology Cluster, which comprised 25+ industrial partners. This initiative concentrated on human-robot interaction and robotics applications, particularly tailored for Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs). Dr. Bdiwi is a member of the national working group for ISO standards in the field of “Industrial robots - Safety” parallel to that he is actively involved in the Arab-German-Young Academy.
summary: Biography Dr.-Ing. Mohamad Bdiwi holds a Ph.D. in Robotics from the Technical University of Chemnitz, with over 16 years of extensive experience in the field, including a commendable 7-year tenure in team leadership.
title: Mohamad Bdiwi

content: Biography Moritz is currently working as a Postdoc at the University of Bonn’s High-Performance Computing and Analytics Lab. Previously we worked as a Research Engineer at the Fraunhofer Center for Machine Learning. He holds a degree in Mathematical Engineering from KULeuven.
summary: Biography Moritz is currently working as a Postdoc at the University of Bonn’s High-Performance Computing and Analytics Lab. Previously we worked as a Research Engineer at the Fraunhofer Center for Machine Learning.
title: Moritz Wolter

content: Biography Radwa Taha is a skilled AI specialist with extensive expertise in deep learning and biometric data. She is currently pursuing her master’s degree at the German University, where her research focuses on leveraging AI technologies in the field of breast cancer. In addition to her academic pursuits, Radwa holds the position of Senior Research Engineer and serves as the Supervisor of the Research and Development department at Enoshsciense Research Center, a research center dedicated to advancements in Acoustics, Education, and AI technologies. Renowned for her meticulous approach, she excels in research synthesis, innovative product development, and managing complex technical projects. Beyond her professional and academic commitments, Radwa is an avid reader, drawing inspiration from literature, and possesses a profound appreciation for visual storytelling, with a particular interest in the works of eminent film directors.
summary: Biography Radwa Taha is a skilled AI specialist with extensive expertise in deep learning and biometric data. She is currently pursuing her master’s degree at the German University, where her research focuses on leveraging AI technologies in the field of breast cancer.
title: Radwa Taha

content: Biography Razieh is currently working as an ML researcher at Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni’s lab. She earned her Master’s degree in Computational Science and Engineering from TU-Munich. While pursuing her Master’s, she completed an internship at BMW, where she worked on ML projects, and concurrently conducted her thesis in AI. Later, she worked at LMU-Klinikum as an AI researcher working on the medical applications of Graph Neural Networks, Transformers, and Explainable AI. She aspires to have meaningful contributions to the intersection of AI and medicine while working at Albarqouni Lab.
summary: Biography Razieh is currently working as an ML researcher at Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni’s lab. She earned her Master’s degree in Computational Science and Engineering from TU-Munich. While pursuing her Master’s, she completed an internship at BMW, where she worked on ML projects, and concurrently conducted her thesis in AI.
title: Razieh Rezaei

content:
Biography Dr. Sally Hassanein is a lecturer in the Biochemistry Department, with a rich academic background spanning pharmacy, biotechnology, and computational biology. She earned her Bachelor’s degree from the Faculty of Pharmacy, Cairo University in 1998, followed by a Master’s degree from the same institution between 2001 and 2004. In 2010, she completed her PhD focusing on genetic polymorphisms in cardiovascular diseases. Since 2012, Dr. Hassanein has served as a Principal Investigator (PI) and Co-PI on multiple research projects and has supervised numerous Master’s and PhD students at the German University in Cairo (GUC).
Over the past several years, Dr. Hassanein has delved into the intersection of biotechnology and computer science. She developed her expertise in R and Python programming, theoretical biotechnology, and multi-omics technologies—laying a strong foundation for her work in cutting-edge fields such as Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS), metagenomics, and multi-omics data analysis. Her collaborative projects with computer scientists and bioinformaticians include applying machine learning models to complex biological datasets, as well as authoring a review article on bioinformatics tools for microbiome research.
Dr. Hassanein’s current research interests center on artificial intelligence and computational medical imaging, particularly in the context of rare diseases. She actively mentors emerging researchers in these areas, contributing to AI-driven healthcare solutions. Looking ahead, she plans to continue expanding her bioinformatics expertise, bridging the gap between computer science and biotechnology to tackle pressing challenges in human health.
summary: Biography Dr. Sally Hassanein is a lecturer in the Biochemistry Department, with a rich academic background spanning pharmacy, biotechnology, and computational biology. She earned her Bachelor’s degree from the Faculty of Pharmacy, Cairo University in 1998, followed by a Master’s degree from the same institution between 2001 and 2004.
title: Sally Hassanein

content: Biography
summary: Biography
title: Sara Alrawi

content: Biography Sarah is currently conducting her master’s thesis at the University of Bonn on AI for medical imaging under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. She is a Master student in Computer Science at the LMU Munich, specialising in Artificial Intelligence. During her studies, she gained practical experience as a working student in software engineering, where she developed mobile applications to help people with aphasia and dyslexia.
summary: Biography Sarah is currently conducting her master’s thesis at the University of Bonn on AI for medical imaging under the supervision of Prof. Dr. Shadi Albarqouni. She is a Master student in Computer Science at the LMU Munich, specialising in Artificial Intelligence.
title: Sarah Schaab

content:
Shadi Albarqouni is a Palestinian-German Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research. He received his B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the IU Gaza, Palestine, in 2005, and 2010, respectively. In 2012, he received the DAAD research grant to pursue his Ph.D. at the Chair for Computer Aided Medical Procedures (CAMP), Technical University of Munich (TUM), Germany. During his Ph.D., Albarqouni worked with Prof. Nassir Navab on developing machine learning algorithms to handle noisy labels, coming from crowdsourcing, in medical imaging. His AggNet paper, published at the Special Issue on Deep Learning at the IEEE Transaction on Medcial Imaging (IF: 10.048), was among the first ones on Medical Imaging with Deep Learning and has been featured as the top downloaded article for a couple of years at IEEEXplore.
Right before he received his Ph.D. in Computer Science with summa cum laude in 2017, Albarqouni worked as a Senior Research Scientist & Team Lead at CAMP leading the Medical Image Analysis (MedIA). Together with his team addressed the common challenges concern the nature of medical data, namely heterogeneity, severe class-imbalance, few amounts of annotated data, inter-/intra-scanners variability (domain shift), inter-/intra-observer disagreement (noisy annotations). In 2019, Albarqouni received the prestigious P.R.I.M.E. fellowship for a one-year international mobility, where he worked as a Visiting Scientist at the Department of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering (D-ITET) at ETH Zürich, Switzerland. He worked with Prof. Ender Konukoglu on Modeling Uncertainty in Medical Imaging, in particular, the one associated with inter-/intra-raters variability. Afterwards, Albarqouni worked as a Visting Scientist with Prof. Daniel Rueckert at the Department of Computing at Imperial College London, United Kingdom.
Since Nov. 2020, Albarqouni has been appointed as an AI Young Investigator Group Leader at Helmholtz AI. The aim of Albarqouni’s Lab. is to develop innovative deep Federated Learning algorithms that can distill and share the knowledge among AI agents in a robust and privacy-preserved fashion. Since Jan. 2022, Albarqouni has been appointed as a W2 Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research at the Faculty of Medicine, University of Bonn.
Albarqouni has more than 100 peer-reviewed publications in both Medical Imaging Computing and Computer Vision published in high impacted journals and top-tier conferences. He serves as a reviewer for many journals, e.g., IEEE TPAMI, MedIA, IEEE TMI, IEEE JBHI, IJCARS and Pattern Recognition, and top-tier conferences, e.g., ECCV, MICCAI, MIDL, BMVC, IPCAI, and ISBI among others. He is also an active member of MICCAI, BMVA, IEEE EMBS, IEEE CS, and ESR society. Recently, Albarqouni has been elected as a member for the European Lab for Learning and Intelligent Systems (ELLIS), the Arab German Young Academy (AGYA), and the Higher Council for Innovation and Excellence‎ in Diaspora (HCIE). Since 2015, he has been serving as a PC member for a couple of MICCAI workshops, e.g., COMPAY, DART, DCL, FAIR among others. Since 2019, Albarqouni has been serving as an Area Chair in Advance Machine Learning Theory at MICCAI. Recently, he has been serving as a Program Co-Chair at MIDL'22 in Swizterland, and as an Organizing Committee Member at ISBI'22 in India, MICCAI'24 in Morocco.
His current research interests include Interpretable ML, Robustness, Uncertainty, and Federated Learning. He is also interested in Entrepreneurship and Startups for Innovative Medical Solutions with limited resources.
summary: Shadi Albarqouni is a Palestinian-German Professor of Computational Medical Imaging Research. He received his B.Sc. and M.Sc. in Electrical Engineering from the IU Gaza, Palestine, in 2005, and 2010, respectively. In 2012, he received the DAAD research grant to pursue his Ph.
title: Shadi Albarqouni

content: Biography Shereen Afifi is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Faculty of Media Engineering and Technology, German University in Cairo (GUC), Egypt. She completed her Ph.D. in Computer Engineering from Auckland University of Technology (AUT), New Zealand in 2018, having received an AUT Vice Chancellor’s Doctoral Scholarship. She received a B.Sc. in Computers and Systems Engineering with honors from Ain-Shams University, Egypt in 2003 and a M.Sc. in Computer Engineering from Arab Academy for Science, Technology and Maritime Transport, College of Engineering and Technology, Egypt in 2012 with an excellent grade. Her research interests include Biomedical Engineering, Medical Imaging, AI & Machine Learning, Computer Vision and Embedded Systems. Dr. Shereen has published over 40 papers in reputable conferences and journals. She is also a member of the IEEE Young Professionals, IEEE Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society and IEEE Circuits and Systems Society. She has been recognized with 7 honors and awards including scientific scholarships, teaching merit and best presentation awards.
summary: Biography Shereen Afifi is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Faculty of Media Engineering and Technology, German University in Cairo (GUC), Egypt. She completed her Ph.
title: Shereen Afifi

content: Biography Yassmine Haggag is a Media Engineering and Technology graduate with High Honors, currently a Teaching Assistant and Researcher at GUC, pursuing a Master’s degree focused on AI and transformers in mental health. Passionate about developing AI-driven solutions to support emotional well-being and mental health care.
summary: Biography Yassmine Haggag is a Media Engineering and Technology graduate with High Honors, currently a Teaching Assistant and Researcher at GUC, pursuing a Master’s degree focused on AI and transformers in mental health.
title: Yassmine Haggag

Slides can be added in a few ways:
Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

title: Example Event
